H0.text: who established the idea that microorganisms play a role in disease. Louis Pasteur

H1.text: who established the idea that microorganisms play a role in disease. Antonie van Leeuwenhoek

H2.text: who established the idea that microorganisms play a role in disease. Edward Jenner

H3.text: who established the idea that microorganisms play a role in disease. Robert Koch

A4.text: Louis Pasteur is regarded as one of the founders of modern bacteriology and has been honored as the 'father of bacteriology' and the 'father of microbiology' (together with Robert Koch; the latter epithet also attributed to Antonie van Leeuwenhoek).

A5.text: Robert Koch had shown that Bacillus anthracis caused anthrax.

A6.text: Germ Theory and Its Applications to Medicine and Surgery, 1878

A7.text: Pasteur's Papers on the Germ Theory
